intro: Gaertnera walkeri var. gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's gaertnera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and are borne in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks.
